gallery.title: Multiscale Mechanics and Atomistic Modeling of Cementitious Materials
gallery.copy: Concrete is the third major culprit of carbon dioxides emission on earth. Through atomistic modeling and molecular dynamics, Yuan is developing computational framework to characterize structural and mechanical properties of cement and concrete and bridge the physical observables from nano to macro scale.

gallery.title: Bio-inspired Structural Composites
gallery.copy: Biological/Bio-inspired/Biomimetic materials provide abundant solutions with exceptional trade-off between fracture toughness and strength unprecedented in engineering materials. In this project, Yuan combines in silico modeling and 3D printing to find special geometry and topology of composites perfecting the efficiency of materials.

gallery.title: Machine-Learning Aided Structure Health Monitoring
gallery.copy: High-dimensional dynamics systems need data-driven strategies to extract features from time series response data. In this project, we use Takens' Embedding Theorem to reconstruct manifolds and adopt Convolutional Neural Network to learn the damage severity and location from excitation-response data.

gallery.title: Molecular Mechanics of Proteins and Biomaterials
